Great running track kept in perfect working order. The "Trim Trail" around the park is nice too with a half dozen different pieces of exercise equipment around the trail to workout on. The park can be very busy on sunny days, but it's a great amenity to have.

The Kensington Memorial Park is a great place to take your children. I was pleasantly to surprised to find out that this park had an outdoor water playground. It was very useful this summer in the hot weather. The kids had great fun cooling themselves off whilst splashing and playing in the water.

On first hearing about a museum made up of lots of very old food packaging, one might not rush to Notting Hill, eager to pay admission to see the inside of what is essentially an old persons food cupboard. However, with packaging and adverts starting from the 1800's and taking you through two World Wars and all the way into the 21st century, this museum fills you at first with intrigue, then nostalgia and recognition. Not to mention the inevietable telling of old stories, prompted by old bottles of Fairy Liquid and tins of Quality Street.
Great staff, great members, great gym!
Lovely quiet spa with a welcoming feel. Massage was very relaxing and I will certainly be returning. Highly recommended.
Amazing facials

'This was my first time at Hydrohealing and my first colonic. Caitlin, was outstanding- she was very knowledgeable, gave me good advise and most of all made me feel so relaxed and explained the treatment as she was doing it. Will definitely be back for a second visit!''
A really nice three-tiered concrete bowl with increasing depths. Step-up/down hips for those that like air and the top section can be used as a mini-ramp for beginners
I had a lovely massage, with Ula, she fixed all of my aches and pains. I will definitely be back again. Very reasonably priced as well. The tea is really great
I came here after reading the reviews. The place and massage were great. They even heat the beds. Definitely recommend!!

I have a large garden, and the Turning Leaves qualified landscaper, (Tristram) created a wonderful garden which included a decking area - and paving area, as well as replace an old fence and build a brick wall. What also amazed me was how Tristram knew all the latin names of the plants and flowers. Tristram is multifaceted and talented as well as being a very organised and tidy worker, with an instinctive aptitude in garden design and I was delighted with the work done - and it was fairly priced in comparison to other quotes.

Cineworld Hammersmith boasts what many cinemas cannot. A wide choice of films from the mainstream to independant to french and polish cinema. It serves the local community whilst being in a beautiful art-deco building. With friendly staff and those willing to go the extra mile to make sure you recieve the highest level of cinema service in London.

Awesome park. Good mix between open grass space for playing sports and sunbathing to sectioned off areas with tables for picnics and areas gardens. There are decent sports facilities with tennis courts, a basketball court and a kids play area.
The perfect neighbourhood park: large, wonderful old trees, lots of happy people playing and lounging on a fine day.

Shhh! Don't tell anyone about this little hidden gem! Public space at its best. Those who frequent this park tend to smile at you and say "hello". Perfect for taking a bottle of something bubbly in summer and relaxing away from the masses.

One of the better Virgin Gyms. Plenty of equipment, pool/jacuzzi/steam room/sauna. Also plenty of room to work out for folks to work out in evenings and weekend as most of the business is during work hours mon-fri.

This gym is just my haven. The facilites are all lovely and clean and the staff are simply amazing! I was a bit of a gym phobe when I joined but the fitness staff are so enthusiastic and fun they really make me get up and go. Whenever I get stuck on new ways to work different parts of my body I just ask one of them and they enthusiastically jump up and show me a million other moves, techniques and machines. I would especially like to applaud Jordan and Stephen for their enthusiasm and customer service. Im always made to feel welcome and I hope that when I move away I get to go to a gym very similar to this one.

I have been traning at West4 for 3 months and I can honestly say it's the best gym I've been too. It has a very friendly atmosphere, great equipment, staff that are really approchable and helpful and my personal traning sessions with Paul have been great. I've really improved my fitness since joining and think membership is excellent value.

I have been a member about 6 months and from the very 1st time going felt very comfortable working out which I feel is very important as some gyms can be a little intimidating. The gym itself is well equipt and the staff friendly and on hand to help and advise with different methods and training strategies. During my time as a member I have felt my own fitness has increased due to the advise given, also financailly very reasonable rates, in fact the best in the area.
Beautiful park and a great place to hang out. We live in a first floor flat so this is out 'back garden'!
Lovely
Best team in the league, no doubt. Great pies, better crowd. COME ON YOU Rs!!!!

We are tempe military football soccer team in bloemfontein who would love and appreciate to have a good run with qpr fc gaints one of the good days anyway the yeam it self is super excellent with sir harry
best stadiem in the world great atmosphere and would defenatly go back

Vue is one of the superior cinema chains in London, although it's reflected in the price (especially at this location). Lots of choices, all the latest releases, enough Pick and Mix choices to make you feel sick and comfy seats. All you really want from a cinema.
Love this cinema, no better place in central where every screen is amazing and the tkts are under £10 ...love love love
Excellent place. They've really helped me get back on track on my fitness. Everyone is so helpful and knowledgable.
I've been training since not long after it opened and had some really great results!

Originally, in 1898 the Coronet was opened to the public as a theatre, however, 25 years later the decision was made to transform it into a cinema. Over time this great building has served many purposes. During the war it was a bomb shelter as well as a place to boost moral thanks to its movies and it was also London's last smoking cinema. Today it remains a place for film fanatics to enjoy great movies in historical surroundings and at unbeatable prices... Read more and explore other unique independent businesses at the Twenty Something London website!

I'd say its one of the best Cinemas in London. Converted from an old theatre it has all of the same original decor and charm. A fresh place to go to watch a film than a standard multiplex cinema. Money and Tuesday are the best days to go if you are a student and fancy a film and a beer for a fiver. Check it out
Love Tuesday's offer! The cheapest in West London. Very nice decoration.

I have been having laser hair removal for 4 months now and have seen a huge difference already! So much so that I have decided to do other areas. The staff are very attentive and make you feel at ease even when under compromising positions!! over the course of the treatments I have expressed my concern about some acne scarring on my face and Karina adviced a course facial peels suited to my skin, they have made a big improvement and given me confidence that I couldn't have dreamt of! A big thank you to the ladies at Premier Laser Clinic in Notting Hill Gate!!
Went to the spa for a massage, which was really nice. Stuff was friendly and the place was clean and quiet. Really enjoyed my visit, defo will be coming back.

I've been going to Zen to have my eyebrows done for many years (6 years ish). The service has always been excellent, from booking appointments (you get a text message to confirm the day and time, incase you forget) to the staff at reception. I used to have my eyebrows plucked (I find waxing doesn't suit my sensitive skin) but for the past three years have been having them threaded and I love it - the best beautican to see is Abi she really is superb!
I don't know why they maon about this shop. Staffs are very friendly.and massage really excellent! Open your mind mate!

Pretty blessed to have this as a local park growing up. It has great tennis courts that are easy to book during off-peak times. The adventure playground always brings me very fond memories as it's very spacious with plenty of swings, slides and climbing frames.
Holland Park is my favourite park in London, a true hidden gem inbetween Kensington and Holland Park. The Japanese Kyoto Garden is a definite must-see.

This is a brilliant park. Great size (with cricket field/sunbathing area and play area for kids). Was very exciting to discover human size chess! The Orangery frequently has weddings so adds to the fairy-tale type feel of the rose garden. Had my engagement photoshoot here and it was perfect! Also great to take the kids!

One of London's less well known parks, but also one of the best. It is a lot smaller than some of the other parks, but size isn't everything. The park is divided into various different areas and includes woodland, various sculptures and other artworks and the remains of Holland House. The giant chess set is a wonderful feature, as are the peacocks that roam the area.
One of the most beautiful parks in London-well worth a visit. Holland Walk is amazing.
best place in London
Spectacular place and the area is probably the best anywhere

I love what I've heard about Kensington Palace, including William and Kate's apartment's renovations! I understand that Buckingham Palace is also beautiful! I want to congratulate William and Kate on the birth of their first child. I've been thinking of names and I like William James Alexander Winsdor. He could be called William Jr. or Willie. I can hardly wait to see who he looks like, and I hope he'll have William's personality. I hope William, Kate and the baby enjoy the rest of the summer, and I wish them the best of luck in the future.
Best ever fish spa in London!
For any new parent, absolute treat to see their little one enjoying the water under the watchful eye of Laura. And, then there is a wonderful massage (for the baby!). Just a delightful experience.
Perfect place if you really want to get fit in a proper way.
Fantastic Service! Really quick really profession and really thorough consultation!

earls court is brilliant for exhibitions because it is spacious and easy to get too. i have been to various events here such as the cake and bake show and the ideal home show and they were both great events. the exhibitions held here are affordable and intresting. i fully recomend this place.

Experience what its like to lead a celebrity lifestyle. The Roof Gardens will amaze you from the moment you walk in. Its like nothing you will see anywhere else in London. The gardens are immaculately maintained and designed to intoxicate every sense. Enjoy a cocktail whilst overlooking the sights of west London, mingling with friends. Then proceed to your table to enjoy food that is not just well cooked but caters for a variety of tastes. Go on indulge yourself.

One off experiences!! Great place for date. You can relax in designers suites in the garden with lilly ponds and flamingos. You can see London in the romantic evening sparkle. Also I recommend oysters dish with great choice of cocktail.
i love the venue ... it is cool and it has a beautiful garden and a great place for a party. i celebrated my birthday there with my friends in june! we had a great time & my friends love it there x

The house is beautifully decorated in the style of the Victorian aesthetic movement, and incredibly well preserved. The hour-long costumed tour is entertaining with "Mrs Sambourne" staying firmly in character throughout. This one of London's little hidden gems, well worth a visit.
Great cinema with great sound, image and seating. Seen a few films there and the experience was a great deal more fulfilling at the Odean that other cinemas I've been to
Enthusiastic trainers and well-maintained fitness equipment, the best gym in my opinion. I want to say big 'thank you' to the whole team for the help.

Beautiful sumptious surroundings and very attentive staff. I was booked in for an hour long massage and a facial, which was a birthday gift from some friends, and was thoroughly pampered. At the end I was given a card entitling me to a discount for future appoints and for products. Would I recommend Adamina to friends - absolutely!!

Excellent gym.... such a great atmosphere and extremely helpful staff that motivate you to really work out rather than just sitting on a bike looking pretty. They are always helpful and give you advice about which exercises may be better than others. They have a great variety of classes some of which are unique (such as hour of power), which are simply fantastic and conveniently scheduled at different times throughout the day so workouts can be scheduled around work. Situated in a great location, with new gym equipment makes this a great place if you want to really work up a sweat and get fit
The kids always have a wonderful time in this almost magical venue in a great location. The haven for grown ups only is a much appreciated addition.
What a great place.
Being training here for 2 years. Its the only thing that has helped my back in over ten years of various treatments.
That is a great beautiful place, wonderful to relax. If you`d wish to walk in some park, I`d recommend you this one
lovely hidden places there
very friendly service and decent coffee

Friendly atmosphere and brilliant trainers. You will leave feeling exhausted, great and with a big smile on your face. Everyone is welcome and that makes it the perfect gym for beginners as well as more advanced boxers. Ben Day has created the best gym in the world.
Ben Day runs a very impressive gym with a very friendly almost family like atmosphere...would recommend Ultra Mitts to anyone, one of my favourite things... Top drawer.

If you want to see an arabic film this is probably the only cinema you can go to in London. The area around the cinema is also very nice and there are many arabic restaurants about (my favourite is Maroush Gardens) if you want to go for an arabic night out :)

This is one of my favourite spas in London. I love going to the hammam for a proper relaxation, I had the body exfoliation and massage it was great. I also had facials on several occasions and had endermologie treatments, I suggest you buy a package when opting for LPG endermologie, it is great for cellulite and fat, I had 7 sessions and was eating healthy, I lost 1.5 inch around arount my hips and 1 inch around my thighs. overall great spa and great beauty treatments.

I can't imagine that I went to the same place as those commenting below because I had a great time and the spa was just as described on the website. I went with my Mum & Sister as a birthday treat for Mum on 25/02/2012. The Hammam treatment was fantastic! The staff were kind, professional and Helen (the owner) was very generous to us. I left feeling so relaxed that the effects were still evident on Monday morning! I liked to thank the staff for everything they did to make us feel welcome and hope the business continues to flourish as I look forward to my next visit. Also great service & value for money!

Honestly a fantastic place! I loved my experience at casa Spa! Right from the start of the treeatment i we comforted by the owner of the spa who welcomed us greatly. my girlfreind and i booked the Arabian Hammam exerience which was heavenly. a deeply tranquil and relaxing treatment that i would definetely recommend. the spa had a great ambiance with the lush morrocan decor and freindly staff. Albosutely breathtaking experience and will definetely be reapeating it! thank you vry much casa spa!
Great Casino one of the greats of London , Just undergoing a refurb at present to accommodate a second licence which means an extra 20 slots totaling 40 read more reviews on my site C4D
Fantastic customer service. Polite, professional, not patronising, great restaurant, just all round superb
Great atmosphere, friendly staff and an all out brilliant evening spending (and hopefully gaining) some money. One of the best in London.
Very relaxing massage, particularly enjoyed the steam room
A great climbing wall - especially for bouldering. Very friendly, experienced staff on hand to give pointers and the routes change weekly

I was lucky enough to train with Anthony when I was on holiday in London in September. I thoroughly enjoyed my training session. I found the session to be full of variety and Anthony trained me to my capabilities. He was friendly, encouraging and very knowledgeable. I look forward to training with him again when I'm next in London!

I hired Anthony 7 weeks before my wedding. Although I did not think this would give me much time to get in shape, I was taken aback by my transformation over the weeks. He is absolutely excellent at what he does - very knowledgeable, approachable and puts you at ease. I highly recommend him. I would also urge others to follow his health and exercise tips because I did and I feel I have benefitted massively. Training with him really is the best investment in yourself that you can make. I have no regrets.

I love this place. The only place where I can get a proper massage that actually releases the tension in my muscles.Its always the first place I go to after a long flight. They are very busy during peak hours so try to book early appointments.
I got the full Lemongrass Total Treat as a present for my 30th and I totally loved it! left feeling like a new-born! Going back next month and bringing my friends for sure ;)
Best location in London for a yoga studio. Cool staff and trendy clients, a winner all round.

It's just the best place in London to get in shape and relax at the same time...absolutely different to any other studio, the most beautiful I've ever been to. With a friendly and chic environment, I feel a new person after the classes every week. If you are thinking about getting fit for the summer you should pass by...worth a try!!
a real break from the boring & ordinary! a place to make friends and get fit while having fun. has been one of my favourite places to go in london for a long time. keep up the good work, girls:)

Egoist Body is one in its kind! A friendly, warm atmosphere with professional approach. One can really feel like at home here! A great place not only to exercise but also to meet new, genuine friends. I highly recomment this place!
This is a wonderful little gallery with some delightful treasures and truly friendly staff. Definitely worth a visit!
Beautiful space! Went to a cupcake and wine evening... Nice people, some great contemporary art.

I love visiting Dr Patel at VIVA clinic. He has been my doctor for 3 years since coming to the UK. My skin is actually perfect now and I will always take his advice. I have no acne breakouts anymore. EVER!

This is a fantastic cinema experience, it's like watching a movie in the comfort of your living room but with a large screen. The seats are wide and comfortable and the choice of cinema snacks is quite cool. Freshly made popcorn and pizza that can be brought to your seat!. I should always come and and watch my movies here!
Best gym for miles. Gets crowded in prime times though.

After staying in the Marylebone Hotel for two nights, I used the facilities of The Third Space. Everybody from the reception to the personal trainers were friendly. The swimming pool was a sight of beuty with a very relaxing atmosphere.

I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!! After a long busy week and a heavy workload I really needed to unwind - this salon helped me to do that. On arrival (5 minutes late) I received a warm welcome by the receptionist and was shortly greeted by an attentive therapist who was brilliant at making me feel relaxed and pampered thoughout my time at the salon - she also makes a great cup of tea. The treatment lived up to my expectations. I had a head, back and neck massage, and a refreshing facial - both of good quality and delivered with good customer care. I left the salon with a smile on my face. And I plan to revisit again soon!

I dont understand the other reviews because I absolutely loved my experience at this salon, maybe things have changed because my treatment was so relaxing and she listened to everything I wanted. The tones in the treatment room created a nice siren mood, I was made to feel so special and was even given a voucher as a first time visitor, I will definitely be coming back for another full body massage, I have never felt so relaxed

If you're thinking of having a massage or need to have an acupuncture treatment, I recommend Elements London which is based in Central London (near Baker Street underground station). The staff are caring and so friendly. I like to stop by after a tiring day at work. Highly recommended :-)

Becky - 24 January 2011. I was fortunate to be invited to a charity auction and was delighted to have a successful bid on a fabulous Terry O'neill picture of Bob Hoskins and Michael Caine.......the service was amazing and it was delivered to my house within a few days....I am looking forward to the next event hosted by Legends. Thanks to all at LCA.

THE CAFE : The cafe at The Photographer's gallery in London W1 is a calm, bright and friendly place. It's central location lends itself as a convenient meeting place where you can enjoy lunch, tea, coffee or a beer. It gets quite busy at lunchtime. Their fare is locally sourced and consists in fresh pasta dishes, freshly made sandwiches, salads, soups, cakes and wonderful pastries. Free WIFI! Highly recommended.

The most interesting place I've ever been to. These days, everyone's a photographer but not everyone actually understands the beauty of it. The gallery is big and they change the exhibitions quite often so you always have something to see.

I have come with some friends here for a couple of drinks! The place is nice! It was a bit crowded the night we visited but there were lots of pretty girls! I am overall glad to come here every now and again!
Had a wonderful time at the 100 last night.

A hidden gem! A museum and shop from a bygone age which still holds a special place for both young and old. Allow enough time to explore toys and paper theaters. The place is a warren of rooms full to bursting with memorabilia. Take home some real toys from your visit.
Just love it here. cant wait for next time!!!

fantastic layout, very friendly staff, spotless and even a fresh smell and to top it all of it was busy with a great selection of guys that where up for it and the price was the same as other places but here you can return free within 24 hours...loved it !
if you love night-life it's one of the best club to go i enjoyed a lot of there
Love it.

When a friend told me she had her lips done i didnt believe her. Her lips looked so natural i genuinely thought she just used a new plumping lip gloss- so she took me to Dermadoc and I had my consultation with a lovely Dr, Dr Tukmachi. He explained the procedure which sounded pretty straightforward and asked me what i wanted to achieve.I had what they called the lip augmentation treatment using the Juvederm Smile. 15 minutes later and the treatment was over. i was truly amazed at the result - very natural and finally i had beautifully defined upper lip. I'm more confident when i smile now :)
I couldnt believe you can have nose reshaping treatment without surgery-i came for a consultation to see Dr Tukmachi. Very friendly and extremely professional. I highly recommend him.

I went to Kings Place to see a comedy show, part of the Off with their Heads! program. The venue was very cozy and easy to navigate, with an intimate room for the main act. The art outside the hall was intriguing and definitely added to the postmodern feel of the place.
Was amazing. Really quirky and different. A must

british libirary is very help full to find out jobs is very easy to go to libirary to sit and reads international books as well people who, alone an does,hv friends they always well cum to sit in the libirary.im very happy for this facialtys people,like us...

Who doesn't love the British Library? A fantastic space with bags and bags of character and stunning architectural views. If you're a keen keen fan of books then definitely get yourselves a reading pass: it'll last up to a year and you get access to every book published in the UK. Win win.
Great place to rest and nibble on your exmouth market snacks and lunches! Plus a supercool back story! And lavender!
Large court, in relative good condition with green tarmac floors. Very lively on the weekends, from 2pm onwards usually.

This theatre is one of my favorite casual weekend activities! Takes you back in time, especially when you go to the late night events, which offer classic movies. You can order bottles of wine or cocktails directly to your seat. Perfect location for a date, especially if you get the tickets for the sofas. Great location in the heart of Angel!

Whether it's with friends, a date or alone (yes TSL love doing the latter – a perfect way to escape from the world) these superbly comfortable sofas, intimate screenings and great films mean that Everyman should become everyone's local... To find more unique and independent places why not visit the Twenty Something London website!
The ideal cinema for a cozy weekend. Large seats and a bar in the back - usually show indie movies and films with a bit of thought behind them.

I went here on a "date night" with my boyfriend and we loved it. Our friends live on this road and recommended it to us. We LOVED the sofas, this was all very new to me, I have only been to a 'normal' cinema before. I have to say I have stopped going to 'normal' cinemas since discovering this place. The snacks are what you would usually expect at a cinema but much yummier! Very good value for a night out. Would highly recommend!
Best cinema in town, or at least in North London. They only have one screen, but they they have big couches and the a bar inside. Best way to enjoy a movie with your partner.
Thankyou to all the team at Angel therapy rooms, everything was perfect and thankyou for letting me drift off to that wonderful place called heaven.....

After first trying out this day spa last year, I now go religiously every few weeks, I've got 2 slipped discs and combine massage with swimming and pilates to keep it healthy. I've had massages all over London and angel therapy rooms is my favourite (especially Fleur and Ricardo - amazing deep tissue)
Really like this place. I've been there twice now and the staff are lovely and good at their jobs. It's a very pleasant place to be, and I think it's good value too.

The only place I've been really helped with my food issue and overall health and wellbeing. So helpful to be told what treatments are and aren't appropriate for me and amazing results on the ones recommended. I can't recommend them highly enough. And it's worth noting that the ASYRA technique with the two metal rods is entirely physics-based and was initially developed to ensure that the first astronauts were sent into space in the peak of health and fitness. I reckon I'm nearly there now...

Great studio for the classes, and the staff have been fabulous. Ive been using this gym for nearly 3 years with Jive Nation - Learn to dance in a day - First Wedding Dance - Wedding Dance London - and its never let me down. Good location, close to the Angel tube station. Its ideal for the beginenrs learn to dance class for modern jive ceroc etc - thanks to the staff, you guys are great

I freaking love this place. Lots of floors and lots of rooms with different things in to choose from. If you're done with dancing to the harder stuff, you can go chill out and watch a movie for a while. If you want to dance to something a little different, just shift over to the next room. There are plenty of bars, and I believe you can bring your own alcohol in. I always go for Slimelight, and have been happily surprised to see some of my favourite bands play there for not a whole lot of money.
clean, professional. fantastic massage.

Amazing, interesting, quirky gift ideas you probably won't find anywhere else. Enormous clocks to stick on your wall, delicious crafty food, lego drink bottles and wall hangings. This was my first stop in London and one of the reasons I love coming here.
I had amazing time with great smiling and friendly staff!!defo coming back!

Amazing experience of Russian culture... no brown bears - just friendly staff, relaxing and rebooting experience and yummy food. Came out completely reborn, after loving beating with Russian Venik and Honey&Salt scrub treatment. Highly recommended for a chill-out day at spa with friends.

Banya No. 1 is just what the doctor ordered on a cold wintry day! It has everything that a proper Russian banya should have - a welcoming and stylish environment, super steam room and of course the "venik treatment" dispensed by skilled "banshiki". At the entrance your are warmly welcomed and explained the basics. You can also buy all the essentials if you just popped in on a spur of a moment: a hat, towel, "venik", slippers etc. You can take your visit at your own pace, but the expert staff will gently guide you towards the best possible way to experience the full Russian banya treatment. The "venik treatment" is a must. It takes only 10 minutes but leaves you invigorated and relaxed. The welcoming sitting area outside of the steam room offers not only quiet corners where guests can relax and chat, play cards or chess but also serves excellent food and drink ranging from cray fish and Russian tapas to a selection of teas and of course the famous Russian yeast drink - "kvas" that is an excelled alternative to Cola! We really enjoyed our visit and already started to spread the word among our friends and colleagues. So do not wait or procrastinate - Go Banya!

Studying for my undergraduate degree; SOAS has its own character, not nearly as clinical as some other universities, with a fascinating history of itself, as well as the best-stocked library on Asia, the Middle East and Africa in the entirety of the UK.
One of the best academic experiences of my life.
A quirky place well worth a casual gander.

The Petrie Museum is my favourite quirky museum in London and houses an impressive array of ancient Egyptian artefacts. Unlike the massive statues in the British Museum, the Petrie's collection focuses on the everyday life of ancient Egyptians - you won't find anything bordering on the significance of the Rosetta Stone, but you will find shrunken heads and ancient erotica.
Lovely little cinema with helpful staff - obviously well-managed. Great cinema with the best new films that make you think.
Very calm and quiet. Great place to relax. And it was a location of BBC "Sherlock"!
It's a nice park for people in what could easily have been a car park

A lot of Dickens memorabilia on show. I highly recommend visiting during the Christmas period if you're around as they've decorated it up with how it would have looked like during Dickens' time. For Christmas 2011, they had a reading every hour from a Christmas Carol in the living room. Hoping to see the completed renovations for Christmas 2012.

If you have a thirst for knowledge on all things postal orientated then this is a must place to visit with a mass of interesting and unusual objects and facts on the subject. The exhibition on the now defunct mail rail throw up facts and unseen photos of the hidden railway most people never knew existed under londons streets. Well worth a visit a true gem
I love playing there.

Fabulous place to visit!! You cannot cover even a fraction of what this Museum offers in one day, but since it is free (like all major museums in London) you can target what you want to see each time you visit. If culture and history are something you enjoy then I would highly recommend this for days out in London. I always put money in the collection stations on the way out.... and would hope that if anyone enjoys their visit that they would do the same.

Went for the first time and I must say it is truly amazing! I would pay entry to see all the artefacts stored here however it's free so that's even better. Quick tip, it took me nearly all day to walk around just one floor so there's always plea Ty to go back for!
An outdoor pool in central London? Yes and its very professionally run. The staff are attentive & well presented. One of London's best pools.
Great place to relax in summer

One of the most comprehensively equipped Stott Pilates Studios in London. Prices for ALL the classes are really accessible for everyone. The Pilates Academy offers a wide range of classes, from Matwork, Group Reformer classes, Athletic Conditioning on the Reformers, Total Barre and Cardio Tramp. They also offer Private 1-2-1 sessions. Love Stott Pilates.

Centrally located, the YMCA is a vast underground gym and sports centre. There is a full sized swimming pool, a fully equipped gym, and multiple studios. Along with the wide variety of classes there is a comprensive after school program for children. Be sure to check out Shorinji Kempo, a dynamic Japanese Martial Art!
Great central london location, bar has great balcony for people watching.
One of the best galleries in london
Spent an amazing day! I really enjoyed my Saturday afternoon at Nickel Spa, it was the most relaxing day for me in the whole week.
The very best gallery in London. Home to great urban art and the official reseller of original Banksy works.

Such a wonderful gallery! My favourite in central London.I've bought a number of lovely art works from here over the years and always been very happy with them.The director, Jill, is so helpful and is always brimming with information about all the artists. The gallery seem to have a very personal and unintimidating approach to selling art, not like many other galleries I go to in London.I've also heard that they have quite a reputation for their work with businesses, art hire for offices and such like, which has been highly recommended by a few of my colleagues (although I've not looked into this myself).All round a lovely spot to pick up some quality affordable art work, as well as a few more expensive classic pieces for the occasional indulgence!
Hugely welcoming. As well as the exhibitions, they have an Aladdin's cave in the basement, thousands of affordable pictures and prints. A wonderful place to browse and pick up a bargain.
Awesome club, delicious cocktails and very friendly staff! I will be back there for sure!
Great collection, worth a look

This has to be one of the loveliest shops in London.. a beautiful house near the British Museum, full to the rafters with good pictures, and there are always good things to be had, even if you're not rich. A special place.
Wonderful original posters with knowledgeable staff, gifts bought for my cousins 40th birthday and one for a colleague's leaving gift, both times they arranged swift and excellent framing. Thank you!
A lot cheaper than other car parks in the area, safe and secure. 3 min walking distance to museums, covent garden n Portugal st
What a lovely group of people.

I went to the Beauty Box Nail Bar for the first time in August and since then I became a regular! The girls are amazing, very professional and friendly! It's a great place to get your nails done! Girls do a great job and the prices are an extra reason to visit them again and again! This is definitely my favorite place to get my nails done!

I would highly recommend Beauty Box to anyone. I often take clients there for manicures and the girls are always ultra professional, friendly and do a brilliant job. What's more, I'm convinced they offer the best value for money in central London. It's a real hidden gem!

Beauty Box is a great place to go to. The girls are very friendly and professional, it is always a pleasure to go there. The prices are more than OK for the quality of the job and I would recommend anybody to go there!

One of my favourite museums in London. Soane was a magnificent architect and his design of his house has some great uses of spaces. You'll see light through glass illuminating sculptures, peer at objects through open spaces and see crafted mouldings that come alive at different angles. Soane really did create an immersive physical experience out of the space. His efforts to create and furnish his house with clutter and objects from around the world means you'll always see something new. I'm a kleptomaniac too, so it's nice to see someone keeping a range of such eclectic objects that all have relevance and meaning. It's great to spend an hour here then come back every year. Every time you'll see more objects and bits of curiosity. It's free too and near a great pub called The Ship Tavern on Gate St that's well worth a visit- decent real ale and pies. Top tip: the first Tuesday of every month is open by candlelight. Great for a date night in the or autumn or winter.

Beautiful place to visit. Soane's collections were fascinating, as was his house, with all its alterations. The quality of light was stunning, and very inspirational. The only thing is that you aren't allowed to take photo's, and there was nowhere to sit and sketch (though I am intending to enquire the next time to see if sketching is a possibility). Definitely worth a visit. The gift shop is pretty good as well!
Well, I like going there in the evening, when the weather is not so warm. I'm often there with my grandfather, because I enjoy listening to his spellbinding stories.
I really like this place. Surprisingly large for a central London gym.

The Hunterian Museum is the literally the most amazing medical museum that I have ever visited. Surprisingly, it's a free attraction, but the quality of the exhibitions is top-notch. There are amazing sights to see, from the Irish giant to numerous horrific-looking tumours. Anybody who has an interest in medicine or anatomy should certainly pay the Hunterian Museum several visits.

I have been a satisfied client of this efficient family-run business for the past three years. From my first visit I was impressed with the immaculate condition of the facility and the expertise of its friendly and courteous staff. Their location is convenient, and parking is never a problem. Best of all, their well-organized scheduling system makes it easy to get an appointment at the most convenient time. I am pleased to recommend this clinic to my family and friends. Excellent!

I come here for botox and could not be happier with the results. Great prices along with an amazing staff. Finally found a medical spa that cares more about me than my wallet. I do actually see results. My face doesn't look frozen. It looks nice and smooth. The staff there was so nice and I will definitely go back again for other treatments. I would highly recommend Dr. Olena Shevchenko and her team to anyone.
Amazing building, beautiful interiors with a lot of history. They give free tours of the building which end in the amazing grand hall. The mosaic ceiling looks amazing.

This is one of the little hidden gems of London. A place soaked in rich, fun, quirky history. You'll get to see some of the underbelly of how society in the UK was organised, and how a rich guild re-invented itself as a major charity. Absolutely fantastic. Superb guides. Very much worth it.

Super gym. Light, airy and open with views from the gym floor over Bunhill Fields one side and the HAC grounds the other. Staff friendly. Can get fairly busy at peak hours with local office workers but outside that and the weekend it's lovely and quiet.
The atmosphere was so lively... my friends and I are already planning the next one.
Incredibly well presented club, hidden in the heart of the city, well run, would definitely go again, maybe sample the VIP area I spied..

This is a wonderful gallery with continuous exhibitions of exciting and often unconventional artists. I particularly like the work of Dale Grimshaw and Barbara Steinberg, who has a current show 'Age and Memory'.

Firstly, Beautcamp Pilates is actually amazing! Extremely tough but worth it! I've tried a number of diets and exercise regimes in the past but nothing has compared to this. Although i have not completed my set of 10 sessions i can already see and feel the difference. The classes only have a maximum of 10 people at one time enabling the trainers to spend time with you in order to help making you feel like you have your very own personal trainer! Overall Beautcamp Pilates gets 10/10 from me!
You guys are brilliant, love my new body to bits! Great fun as well and perfectly located for me in West London near to home.

Excellent gallery - wonderful use of space. Especially loved the Nathan Bowen pieces! If someone was to ask me where to buy affordable art in London I would definitely recommend this as one of my galleries of choice.
Cheapside Hoard a fabulous exhibition - best for ages. Great mix of the story, pictures and artefacts from the period and, of course, the jewellery itself.

This is one of my favourite museums. From the 11th of October I'll be able to visit an exhibition called London's lost jewels. I'm excited, because I saw in the website what is on these days. I'm planning to spend some pleasant time in the museum.
Very nice, interesting place.
Best way to spend your lunch hour if you work in the area. Quiet, off the street, and just unknown enough to be a real gem in the City.
Best gym in London.

Really good gym - the staff are friendly and helpful (I forgot my card a few times but they let me off and gave me a temporary pass). The personal trainers are very helpful and even helped me with a few exercises despite not being a client. Free towels, good showers and plenty of lockers.

An excellent little gallery, not the easiest to find, but one of the more interesting small art galleries in London. The collection is limited but lovely and the events held there are always engaging and exciting!

Really worth a look if you are into watches (or clocks). Some of the earliest (16th century) watches on display and of course the early Harrison chronometer. Only one room so it only takes 45 minutes to an hour to view completely. And it's free!

Really, REALLY good (if you like clocks). Only one room but lots to looks at. Lots of great clocks and watches with some stranger ones including a Hydrogen Clock, Rolling Ball clock and decimal watch. Also, it's off the tourist trail so it's nice and quiet.

I actually taught a HypnoBirthing course here and found the yoga/classroom to be very comfy. The gym is a good size with great equipment. The staff are very polite. There is also a comfy reception space to cool off in after a workout.

I have been training with Phil at Cre8 for the past three years and I have found his targeted training regime to be very effective. I am fitter, leaner and stronger as a result. Whatever your level of fitness, the guys at cre8 will create a programme that will help you to improve. I strongly recommend giving them a go!

Fantastic private gym in the very heart of the City of London. The Fitness Team are fabulous. Sarah Lindsay is a great personal trainer and really seeks to understand her clients, their lifestyle, and medical history, working closely with her clients to achieve the best possible results. Nutrition is a core part of the program, along with the fortnightly health checks, Embody Fitness ensures that they have all bases covered. Added bonus is that Sarah is a former Olympian with a steely determination to get her clients into shape and she knows just how to motivate them.

Professionalism does not reflect the level of expertise at Embody Fitness. The staff are exemplary in their commitment to achieve results which is reflected through their tailored training programmes, individualised nutrition plans and their continuous support, encouragement and honest feedback. If you want to take a real responsibility for your health, improve your fitness and see real body changing results then there is no where else to go but here.

Amazing gym! I've had personal trainers in the past, but none of them even come close to the embody fitness team. My trainer Sarah Lindsay's knowledge on nutrition and her training sessions have helped me massively! I would highly recommend!! I would never go anywhere else now

Winter wonderland in Hyde Park is the ultimate Christmas Destination in London. Starting from end november to begin of January, its a fab place for dates, families, group outings. Ice kingdom, ice skating, zippo circus, german market, angel and yuletude market, lots of mulled wine and xmas goodies.

The Serpentine summer pavilion is one of my favourite places to visit during the summer months. Each year a different architect is chosen to create a temporary sculpture. Every year the different creative interpretations to the space are fantastic to see.

I went to this amazing outdoor installation recently - and they had a cafe within it. Completely charming and hidden away in the depths of Hyde Park. Not far is the Diana memorial which is lovely. Go here during the week on a sunny day and you're set!
Directly opposite the Royal Albert Hall and 0.2 miles away from the Jamaica tourist board, very convenient!
Best club around. good vibes

One of the most beautiful parks in London. Located at Kensington Parks, gentle fountains and white stone gardens await for you to disconnect from the daily routine. After that, a nice walk through the rest of the park is a must!
Really friendly staff, and lovely space. The quality of their artists is second to none, go there now!
I feel so relax! haha I feel I'm a princess setting to a chair were you feel your foot pampered. Good job guys!

My friend treats me to a spa and they send me in this place. They have a parking area which I park my car in a right position. The receptionists are well groomed and they are all pretty. They also have a sweet voice, in a lower tone voice.
Very Professional, rapid and efficient team. Highly recommended.
Lovely staff, incredible customer service!!

A very calm place where you could spend very little time just wondering and taking in the atmosphere or a lot of time examining every detail. Wonderful staff make for a refreshing experience with plenty of experts willing to spend time with individual people.
Loved the ambiance...not to forget the history that unfolded here!
your three stone rings design are fabulous.

Nice place with great facilities. I had wonderful experience here. My massage was one hour, but felt like much more. The atmosphere was incredible. Music made me go beyond my dreams and relax. Highly recommend it!

I've had a well-being Massage for 1h spending a lovely time, getting fully-relaxed and refreshed. Definitely recommend to everyone! The therapist were really pleasant and professional and the spa centre at all is one of the best in London area.
Lovely paintings. A must view - especially the Cypresses and Pines (circa 1913)! Nice Lowry too near the loo.

I was gifted three rings from Monica Vinader, and I am very happy with the quality of the products. The moonstone is particularly beautiful and matches everything. The rings are all unique, so they allow you to browse through their collection to find one that appeals specifically to you.
This is a special place. Great premises,helpful and friendly staff. reasonable rates. if you are in the West End H2 is a must!!
Very educational and interesting
Fantastic, historic environment. Great talks.

Thoroughly enjoyed my recent visit to the new Halcyon Gallery on New Bond Street. The artist Dale Chihuly is currently gracing the floors walls and ceilings with his genius. Look out for one of his sculpture on Park Lane opposite the Dorchester..I am very much much looking forward to all that the Halcyon has to share with us over the coming years.
Very nice gallery, amazing young artists, cool staff!!
Amazing gallery. Every exhibition is so fresh and exciting.
Great dealer with always very interesting items

One of the grandest art institutes in London. There is always an impressive exhibition going on. The exhibitions are well curated, informative, and have the best pieces in the world to see. Becoming a friend of the RA gives you free entrance which is worth it if you are interested in arts.

I've been a member of the Third Space for over 3 years and have really enjoyed the experience. Having never been one for group classes I was pleasantly surprised by the classes offered and the staff qualifications of the trainers conducting the classes. The gym offers an excellent range of sports and exercises with some really experienced trainers. I guess the best endorsement that I can give the gym is that it is a pleasure to visit and that is what anyone from a top class athlete to a general fitness enthusiast should want from a gym.
Recently joined the club and I'm really pleased of the results that I've accomplished! The personal is friendly and the facilities are decent!
Great space, Fantastic show. Joan Mitchell. Let those who don't like it go else where. More space to look at the paintings for those with eyes to see.
Great Park. Relaxing Vibes. Table tennis is incredible.
Helpful staff, excellent collection of Picasso and Matisse.
We are regular cinemagoers and Curzon Mayfair is our "local" -- even though we live in Berkshire. Civilised, organised and always a thoroughly pleasant experience.

Dunja has done permanent make up for eyeliner on upper and lower lids, and my lips. Each time I was thrilled with the result. It was totally natural looking and I have received many compliments from people who cannot believe that the make up is permanent, as it doesn't look over done, as in many instances. She is to ally professional and matched my skin tone perfectly. I highly recommend her to anyone. Amanda in Kensington

I've known Dunja for about 3 years now and not only is she lovely with a great sense of humor; she is also amazing at what she does. She has done my permanent makeup eyeliner and my eyebrows and I am super pleased with the results. She has saved me so much time getting ready in the morning!! On top of that she also permanently colored in the childhood scars on my knees which has really helped create a more flawless leg look. I will actually fly to London from New York to see her for permanent make up treatments because she is just worth it!
I like the Palm Beach, I think it's great. Very nice staff and people, and beautfiul, relaxing environment.
Superb staff And great atmosphere
A great way to carry on the night after Mahiki or Funky B. Hot dancers, nice venue and reasonable drinks prices- a much better choice than the over-saturated commercial alternatives- a class above.
If you ever want to feel like James Bond this is the place to go. Super posh with class and polish. Superb, frankly.

Dopo anni di piacevole "vicinanza di casa", Brancolini Grimaldi - l'unica galleria fotografica a Roma degna di questo nome - ha purtroppo lasciato la sua sede di via dei tre orologi per trasferirsi al 43/44 di Albemarle Street First floor, vicino all'ufficio postale. Alle pareti opere di gran livello di fotografi quotati come Vitali, Clare Strand, Lise Sarfati, Domingo Milella e Peter Fraser. Un indirizzo da non perdere per tutti gli amanti della fotografia di passaggio nella Londra che conta.
hey jo has a exceptionaly nice decor, very different from wht we see in other clubs. The music is quite diverse and you never get bored.
i love this place excellent club

Ritz Club London perfect for those who likes quiet evening in a high-class surroundings. Ideal for whiskey & cigar relaxation. Jazz evening at the Club is an absolute must. There is no other venue in London as rich in decor as Ritz Club. Highly recommended.
Great morning at the White Cube. Serene space. Interesting art. Bookshop offers artists prints.
Japanese Art here is incredible and very reasonable, bought a little Netsuke here for my wife. She loved it
A great place to come as an audlt with out kids around to really discuss the issues bhind today's science. Nice that they have a bar there as well.

This museum is interesting and the personnel is friendly. I've recently checked the website and realised a fascinating fact - you can make ink from mushrooms. All kids will have the opportunity to try such exciting thing. They can go to the museum for more information. But it is not fear, even if I'm an adult, I want to attend such events too.

Beautiful building, and inside free access to pretty much the complete history of the natural world. A really great museum. In addition to all the nice things others have mentioned I would add that there are also special exhibitions happening, like the Wildlife photographer of the year.

Most of the good stuff is free to access! There's a TON of stuff to peruse here that you can easily take an entire day digesting all that this place has to offer and still have many left for a return trip. If you're a photographer, it is also worth checking with them if you can be included in the "early access" privilege tours so that you can take photos of that fantastic architecture inside. I personally try to visit the museum 4 times a year as they tend to change things around. The NHM is a must-visit if you have kids with you as the museum has taken a lot of effort to make sure that it leaves a lasting impression to kids. All in all, one of the places to visit if you're in London!

A 'real' IMAX experience with all the wonderful nature and science movies that take advantage of what IMAX has to offer. Don't be fooled by those puny screens that claim to be IMAX only because they check some boxes, this is what IMAX is all about.

An amazing place to get lost in on a care free weekend. Recently went to the memory palace exhibition which displayed a variety of art works and installations. The garden and fountain is a perfect place to spend a summer afternoon with a book. Recommend the Lates exhibition they host monthly.
I cam here for a massage. An amazing club, very clean, quiet, unpretentious.The pool was a delight. Highly recommended
Great place for fitness
Perfectly equipped and well-kept. Recommend it!

I have been seeing Dr Kubicka for a few years now for fillers and botox which look really natural but take years off me. First found her at Urban Retreat in Harrods and now she has her own clinic which is a gorgeous little place and really serene.
I LOVE BOUJIS!!!!!!!! Best nightclub in London - Fact.
I visit them every now and then to keep fit and I'm pleased with the place. I can even park my motorcycle in front.
Lovely cinema with a unique, warm and welcoming atmosphere.

Chelsea Gardener have tended our garden since last summer (2010). They have both knowledge and enthusiasm and focus on the task at hand. There is a refreshing pride in the work that they do. We are happy to give them our unequivocal recommendation.

What a fantastic selection of all kinds of cards and gifts, all can be found in this welcoming little South Kensington shop! It can be crowded, but shoppers are friendly and the owner could not be more helpful in guiding people to the types of cards they wish to purchase. This is the only place in London where I go to buy my Christmas cards, and I'm counting down the days until they come out!

No gallery like that in London. Great exhibitions all the time. I rememeber the one with the Queen portrait and colorful landscapes. The space is amazing and the light in there makes the place a relax space. The outfit of the staff is stunning.

Modern art in the heart of Chelsea. The new and young artists showcased should make you realize that talent and passion are alive and well in the 21st century. The beautiful museum houses what I think is the best modern art in London, a tie with the Tate. The special exhibitions are always incredible and it's well worth a visit for any art afficianado .
I liked the art work alot didn't want to leave
Very interesting place, I recommend the audio guide!
Exiting place. Nice collection which was well described with audio guide.
Grand spectacle, well worth a look.

This is my favourite place in all of London. You can pay a lot of money elsewhere to see exotic birds but they have dozens of species in this park. There are pelicans which are very entertaining to watch, a number of types of geese, many ducks including rare species and non-native ones and millions of coots. There are also some swans. In the evenings at dusk you can see bats. In one direction you can see Horseguards Parade and in the other Buckingham Palace. Best place to take somebody new to London.

A fantastic park to take a walk through and spend a quiet afternoon. There are many lovely gardens, ponds and other greenery to discover and is very serene. It is also located near many London landmarks and can be a nice reprieve from the city. There are nice views of nearby Buckingham Palace, and Big Ben and Westminster Abbey are also close by. Early evening is a great time to go.

I try not to let myself lose shape and this gym is always my best choice. Every now and then I come here for a refreshing workout. The equipment is in good condition and there is always room for all the people who visit.

The Light Centre was recommended by a friend and it has lived up to its billing. It is a great venue with a range of classes and friendly staff. The prices are in the mid-range but provide good value and the location is good for those working in the city with easy transport links via Victoria Station. I have taken a yoga class for beginners and have been impressed by the tutor and classes. I like to come in a little earlier than scheduled and am able to sit in the quiet, green and airy lounge area and gather my thoughts and catch up on reading. Overall a highly recommended retreat for those in need of yoga, pilates and a variety of other relaxation needs. Liked: Venue and location, value and excellent service of all staff.
Over 60 yoga and pilates classes a week! Lovely people. Inexpensive, plus lots of therapies and now they have a gym and a juice bar.
It is very elegant and a fantastic place to stay at
Photo realism at its best
Been to some great galleries, but this one is a gem, recommend a visit.
have been there for three, but feel they are very professional and nice, my knee is getting better.

Amazing gym. Spacious, clean with friendly staff and the personal trainers are excellent. Although I became a member quite recently, I can see some substantial results in terms of my goals coming my way. In a very convenient location as well.
Othalias security is the art of providing a protection. For venues , parties , events personal protection. Email us to know more about the service we can provide. othaliassecurity@live.co.uk.
For cinema, I love to go there as it provides a wide and interesting range of films. Usually weekday afternoons are very quiet. There are cafe downstairs and very cozy. Its also great location.
Great music, great atmosphere, alcohol priced reasonably, had great time
awsome place....sunday cabatey plus funky after party ... the dancers ate amazing

Only ever been on a Friday and Saturday, but it's incredible! The music is brilliant; some swing, jazz, northern soul. Great staff who are very friendly and more than happy to give dance lessons as the night grows quieter to the end. Friendly door staff which is a nice change from the norm. All in all, an excellent place to go - hence why I've just got back in from my second night in a row!
Lovely place! One of my favourite things are the ultra violet pool balls and the fruit slot machines! Service is flawless and I managed to win a buck or two!
Girls are really good here. They do not hustle and speak good English
Loved it
Authentic Thai spa experience in relaxing, yet central location. I'd especially recommend their massage and Seven pollen facial care. Definitely worth a visit.

Very nice and experienced instructors. Feels great after the class. Definitely recommend to anyone looking to take a break and release stress from their busy lives. Joining Yotopia and practicing Yoga regularly is such a great experience.

Yotopia not just offers excellent yoga courses and classes. It also helps you to bring balance and harmony to all aspects of your life with the help of workshops. If you want to expand your understanding about yoga, then this is the place for you. Wonderful atmosphere to practice yoga. Check it out for yourself.

Fantastic place, I got a voucher back in January, and it's been good enough that I keep on paying full price for the classes. They offer a student discount as well (15%), which is nice. I like the range of options: different levels, and fusions like Hot Ballet and Yogalates. The instructors are all amazing, and tend to be very experienced (most seem to have taught for 10+ years).
Visited Covent Garden and came across this stall and wanted to buy everything! Really original pieces with intricate work, bought a couple of unique pieces, that look beautiful in my home.
Most charming cinema in London Intimate but seats all give great view of screen. Right in central London so easily accessible. Cheaper than most other central London cinema
im mamber there but i dont visit very often couse of money but i do enjoj there so much very cheerful atmostfear.. free juce and tea coffee they serve i enjoy always...

Great night out with my friends! Totally took advantage of the Happy Hour where cocktails were 2 for 1! And then we ventured down to the club when it opened at 10pm and danced the night away. Great West End venue with a beautiful view of London. Really friendly staff and we took lots of pictures! Will definitely be returning soon!

I love this cinema, whenever I don't know what to see, I turn up here and go to whatever is on. It always has an intriguing and wonderful selection of world and independent cinema and rarely disappoints. Give it a go :-)

This is a great place to take children and young teenagers to. I took my little cousin a few weeks ago and he absolutely loved all the wacky unique objects in there and was telling his friends all about what he had seen there. An absolute must do if you are in London

I visited the Excellence of London on May 14 '13. I have no idea which store the other reviewer visited but the staff were wonderful & helpful. I found exactly what I wanted @ wonderful discounted pricing for beautiful quality. I plan on returning to the store on my next visit to London. Keep up the GOOD service with quality.

Pop in ,go up the grand escalator and see the finest Tudor Portraits in the UK.See Elizabeth the first in all her glory and her puffed up father. Stroll into the restaurant for a great view of London. Many of the exhibitions are free and are well worth seeing.
Nice place to relax, play cards, roulette ect reasonably priced drinks, friendly staff had a good time and went home £200 up.

Gymbox is the only gym I'll go to. Having done Virgin, FF, David Lloyds and LA Fitness, none are as fun and full of life as Gymbox. Each gym also has a different vibe. The Sheps Bush one is great for a legs day, airy, well lit and very cool. The St. Martin's Lane Gymbox is full of beautiful people and the Holborn one is rammed with A-Types - great for an efficient workout. Easy to recommend, not least of all thanks to the friendly staff. Also - the trainers aren't too pushy.
I workout here often and the place is really great. You get 5 star quality at a 3 star price!

Fantastic place to visit! The permanent exhibition shows so much history about how the London Transport network started and even has real old buses and coaches to sit on and try. They often have an excellent temporary exhibition that is constantly changing. A few I have seen recently were a fantastic show of how the underground map has changed over the years, and their current one which showcases the top 150 posters from the history of the 150 years of transport underground. A must see!

One of my favourite buildings in London - always worth a look-in if you catch it on an open day. It's basically a gothic mansion with lots of neo-Tudor touches - incredible wooden fireplaces, doors, staircases. Lots of interesting exhibitions on but really it's just worth going for a wander round and bit of escapism.
Nice little gardens, a little bit hidden away! Nice venue for free summer events, like the swing dance picnics run last summer with swing bands playing on the stage.
Walking through these gardens gives you a Who's Who of Victorian London. The more important a person, the larger their statue. A pocketful of peace in the centre of a busy city!
A little peace of heaven hidden in the big city. Lovely green park, very well maintained. Perfect for walks.
I liked this place because this a very good live band everyday. There is a good service there. Very good drinks and foods. All staff are very friendly.
A very well equipped gym. The personal trainers are great and the atmosphere there is great,
Fantastic collection of impressionist art alongside various other beautiful items set in a fabulous building. What's not to like?
Great food and drink. Very nice place to be.

I have been a member here for over 2 1/2 years and could not be more pleased with my experience working out there. The staff are v friendly and I receive a warm welcome each time I come into the club. The club is kept clean and tidy and classes are superb - energetic and fun! There is all the equipment I require there as well as their new freestyle area which offers alternative new training methods and knowledgeable and friendly staff. I have been able to achieve my original goals from when I joined and now I am working towards being in the best shape possible! It closes at 9pm which is a bit early but apart from that I couldn't recommend it more!
Excellent experience about all: service, food, atmosphere, ect. very very good.
The most unique gallery I have ever been to. Astonishing works from an amazing artist.

Having looked for advice regarding a painting I was looking to sell , I received expert and impartial advice from Macintyre Art Advisory and satisfactorily sold my work via an auction house through their professional channels.. highly recommended! Charlie Whitaker

Went with a friend, exceptionally good food. Foie Gras Terrine was simply incredible, haggis very good, and the cranachan with a suitable kick. Service staff attentive but not over-bearing. Will be going again.

One of the places in London that overflows with culture, things to do, great food, and good company. Southbank Centre is a perfect place to bring a special someone to spend a nice evening with. Easily accessible via public transport, I recommend that you get off of Embankment station, and get to the Southbank Centre via the bridge. Spectacular views of London at night and a fantastic atmosphere that just completes the evening. After visiting the centre, I highly recommend walking by the river towards the London Eye, where you have various street performers doing their thing.

we went there in a sunny day and it was very busy and there was lots of cultural activities as well. we walk by the river and watch the people who entertain the people with music and other activities. there were many cafe and restaurant around to enjoy variety food. Also me had a chance to explore Malaysian culture week and also Swedish. i had a lovely time with my friend as all over it had a lovely vibe.

I am totally in love with this brutalist concrete building. Not only does it contain three of the most acoustically perfect concert halls in the world: the Royal Festival Hall, the Queen Elizabeth Hall, and the Purcell Room; it is also the home to the incredible Hayward Gallery. Oh and just to top it off there is a fantastic edible garden to enjoy the summer from on the roof

It was such a great experience. We walked thorugh the thames river. there are really nice coffie shops where you can sit and sip your latte by the view of thames... I love it and I will definatly come here back. I tottally recommend. enjoy!

This place is really happening on the weekend. I was surprised the first time I came here, I couldn't believe how much stuff was going on (craft fairs, performances, popup stalls, etc). There is a regular food market on weekends, selling all different types of delicious street food. The view from the top floor out over the Thames is spectacular, although a lot of people don't seem to know about it. It's a great place to take tourists.
Watched gravity the film here on a weekend, booked the tickets with ease through the web and with reasonable prices. Lovely place and setting around it. Would definitely come for another visit.

Definitely worth to visit even if you aren't interested in sea life. It's it very interesting and educating. I made thousand of amazing pictures. The building is also structured very well and makes it easy to walk around. There are huge number of aquariums to explore and I would recommend to anyone visit this place.
The BFI houses two cafes, shop, library (free), mediatheque (free films! woohoo!) and FOUR cinemas! It hosts a collection of fantastic film seasons and is definitely worth a visit for film lovers.

Great value for money, take a tour into movie history with props and costumes from the movies. Get your photo taken in a set from Star Wars, I enjoyed every minute of it and would really recommend it to anyone who's a movie fan.
Definitely the best gay sauna in London - great central location, always open, always a good mix of men who want to get off. Totally love it.
I had some nice moments right here

Great gym for weight lifting. Their free weights area is well-equipped with two squat racks, plenty of dumbbells, Olympic barbells, etc. They also have a good selection for bodyweight exercises. And I have to say that the interior is beautiful (brick ceiling situated under the train bridge) and very open with lots of natural light during the day.

Definitely a recommendation for those visiting London! I took the trip from Westminster to Greenwich, which lasted about an hour. It's a very comfortable ride, and if you don't mind a bit of cold, the views on the upper deck are spectacular. We had Simon, who was part of the crew, who guided us with some excellent commentary along the way. Travelling along the Thames, there were a lot of things I didn't know about, and a LOT of Pubs that I didn't realize had quite the history. Apparently, the crew know their pubs along the Thames quite well! Again, a great way to travel one of the most important parts of London, the River Thames, I highly recommend getting in on one of the cruises.

As the Southbank does not have page thought I would review the surrounding area including the skate park. Southbank is beautiful and there are plenty of things to do without paying a penny! Gets really busy on Saturday afternoon in December. Wonderful Christmas market- Bavarian as seems to be the fashion but brilliant atmosphere, loads of lovely stalls not to mention food and drink and all along the river. Better then the other so called winter wonderland! There's a fantastic street art / graffiti mural skate park under the first bridge. The BFI is great with film archives and terminals that yoi can browse for free. You can see parts of the globe at one end and take in the best parts of london. Around Christmas expect to see lots of festive events including a chocolate festival

The great big brown brick-clad building on the south-bank of the Thames contains one of the world's most celebrated collections of modern art. I've just returned from yet another mind-nourishing wander around it's huge halls. There are two things I've always enjoyed most about the Tate. Firstly, the thematic presentation of it's work. Rather than chronological periods, the art is grouped into collections, such as 'states of flux' and 'poetry and dreams', which place old classics in new context and allow visitors to listen in on the interesting conversations going on between the art and artists across large periods of time. Secondly, it is constantly changing. No two trips to the gallery are ever the same. Walls have moved. Grand new projects have been set up in Turbine Hall. Art has disappeared and new work has emerged. Read more about my experience and see my photos on Triptease.

If you are first time in London and only have a few days here, Tate Modern is a must-see place! Love this place and I spent 6 hours here on a relaxing Sat afternoon. With interesting modern arts and paintings. Kids-friendly and educational! :)

If you are in London, then Tate is the most recommended and a must to visit place. With many great exhibitions and art galleries it is awesome. I f you are fond of contemporary art, you will enjoy. A unique experience, well done!

Tate Modern is a great place to be. There is always a great range of exhibitions to see. We went to see the basement gallery. The show is amazing. The bookshop is the best for arts - well worth a visit

This is one of my favourite places in the city to come for a break especially on evenings in the spring/autumn. When the courtyard is all but empty this becomes a place where you can really take a step back and enjoy London.

This is a fascinating place: for the sight of David Kirkaldy's testing machine itself, which the building was constructed around, and for its role in developing the disciplines of engineering and materials technology. I was delighted to discover it a few years ago.

Marvel at the foundations of antiseptic surgery (Lister's original equipment) and nursing (Nightingale's records), along with early pharmacy and operations without anaesthetic. For doctors and patients of chronic curiosity.

I have been using Paris Gym since 2010 and, although I have tried other gyms in Central London, I wouldn't change it. Apart from its high-standard training equipment, what has particularly kept me all these years is its friendly environment; the service has always been excellent, the owners very warm -and often around- and the staff very friendly and consistently ready to help. I am a student and I have even used the cafe area of the gym to work on my computer several times (using the free wifi), as I normally go there after the library. Concerning the gym's extra facilities, bicycle parking always comes in handy. I also love the idea of the 'dog parking' - I don't have a dog, but I'm always happy to see them when I enter the gym. I have been using the £43 membership, but being a student it would have been very useful if they made relative discounts; however, the price definitely corresponds to the quality of the gym and I have always preferred it to the much more affordable University gym.
My favorite recreational spot. I've been a member for the last few months and I feel great about myself. The programs are refreshing and the equipment is the best I've seen in a health center.

Musclebase Gym: A local family run gym based in Ponders End part of Enfield in London. The gym offers the following facilities and services to gym visitors / Gym members: * Bodybuilding and weight training. * Nutritional advise and bodybuilding supplies. * Punchbags and a Boxing room. * Gym quality spa quality professional grade Sauna * Professional grade Sunbeds * A variety of membership packages on offer. * Unisex friendly and safe gym. Musclebase Gym is one of the best hardcore yet friendly family run health club / gyms in London. Muscle-Base gym is a products of more than 30 years of experience in the " bodybuilding game" as the founder calls it. The founder has great passion for everything bodybuilding, his aim is to create a gym where both bodybuilders and amartures can come and train using quality equipment. Musclebase gym seems to want to maintain the hardcore gym image characterised by its selection of only solid metal equipment. Ken the owner has a story to tell, he tells everyone who is willing to listen of how he started the gym, and most new members and visitors get an unrushed tour of the gym.

Beach London is a one-of-a-kind gallery and shop come café that has the noteworthy aim to make art part of one's daily routine. No need to be a member of Sotheby's or to charm one's way into the hands of a well-connected art dealer as Beach London present talented local artists to be loved by all. TSL suggest you come here to do many things; buy a cup of coffee while browsing the gallery, attend the bi-monthly free art shows or even buy a quality and reasonably priced prints ranging between £15 to £70. No doubt it's a great place to pop in for a beverage while gaining a dose creative inspiration. To find more unique and independent places why not visit the Twenty Something London website!

For TSL, anything that involves travelling off the beaten track mixed with a healthy dose of free art is definitely worthy of attention. Meet Raven Row, an inconspicuous independent gallery tucked behind the well-known Spitalfields market near Liverpool Street station. Whether you're city folk in need of inspiration during your 15 minute (make that 5) lunch break, or just in the Shoreditch area on the weekend and fancy an art trip, either way, walking round Raven Row is definitely worth your while... To read more and explore other unique independent businesses, check out Twenty Something London's website!

Contemporary art gallery run by Alex Sainsbury. This non-commercial gallery is pretty influential on the UK art scene. The gallery is set over 3 floors of a beautiful 18th century house. The last show i visited they were providing good quality catalogue books of the exhibition for free.
It was appeal but not to my style of art, however the work was very interesting and it wasn't to busy so you got the best service as well more time and space to look at the work.

Beautiful place with lots of character and unique overall feel. I've been here so many times and whoever I take with me, they're always left impressed and stunned by the exhibitions. I'd recommend it highly.
